Package texteditor

Class TextEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • texteditor.TextEditor
  • public final class TextEditor
extends java.lang.Object
    TextEditor represents a class that can be used to process, manipulate, and analyze text.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TextEditor​(java.lang.String document)
      Constructs an instance of a TextEditor object initializing it with the provided document, and initializes the dictionary of words.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void copy​(int i, int j)
      Copies the text from ith character to the jth character in the document (exclusive).
      void cut​(int i, int j)
      Cuts the text from ith character to jth character in the document (exclusive).
      java.lang.String getText()
      Returns the string representation of the entire document.
      int misspellings()
      Counts and returns the number of misspelled words in the entire document.
      void paste​(int i)
      Pastes the text in the clipboard into the document starting from the ith character.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextEditor

        public TextEditor​(java.lang.String document)
        Constructs an instance of a TextEditor object initializing it with the provided document, and initializes the dictionary of words.
        Parameters:
        document - the text file that needs to be loaded into the editor
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if document is null

    • Method Detail

      • cut

        public void cut​(int i,
                int j)
        Cuts the text from ith character to jth character in the document (exclusive). If the ending index is greater than the length of the document (in terms of characters), then the cut text ranges from starting index to the end of the document.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the starting character that needs to be copied
        j - the index of the ending character that needs to be copied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if j < i or i < 0 or i > document length (in characters)

      • copy

        public void copy​(int i,
                 int j)
        Copies the text from ith character to the jth character in the document (exclusive). If the ending index is greater than the length of the document (in terms of characters), then the copied text ranges from starting index to the end of the document.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the starting character that needs to be copied
        j - the index of the ending character that needs to be copied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if j < i or i < 0 or i > document length (in characters)

      • paste

        public void paste​(int i)
        Pastes the text in the clipboard into the document starting from the ith character.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the starting character in the document
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i > document length or clipboard is null

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the string representation of the entire document.
        Returns:
        String representation of the text file

      • misspellings

        public int misspellings()
        Counts and returns the number of misspelled words in the entire document.
        Returns:
        number of misspelled words in the text file
